psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 88,10b]]Daily I call upon you, O LORD;
[[Ps 88,10c]]to you I stretch out my hands.
[[Ps 88,11]]Will you work wonders for the dead? 
Will the shades arise to give you thanks?

[[Ps 88,12]]Do they declare your mercy in the grave, 
your faithfulness among those who have perished?  
[[Ps 88,13]]Are your wonders made known in the darkness, 
or your justice in the land of oblivion?

[[Ps 88,14]]But I, O LORD, cry out to you; 
with my morning prayer I wait upon you.
[[Ps 88,15]]Why, O LORD, do you reject me; 
why hide from me your face?

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 9,57]]As Jesus and His disciples were proceeding on their journey someone said to him, "I will follow you wherever you go."
[[Lc 9,58]]Jesus answered him, "Foxes have dens and birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to rest his head."
[[Lc 9,59]]And to another he said, "Follow me." But he replied, "Lord, let me go first and bury my father."
[[Lc 9,60]]But he answered him, "Let the dead bury their dead. But you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God."
[[Lc 9,61]]And another said, "I will follow you, Lord, but first let me say farewell to my family at home."
[[Lc 9,62]]Jesus answered him, "No one who sets a hand to the plow and looks to what was left behind is fit for the kingdom of God."

first_reading.title: Book of Job
first_reading.text:
[[Jb 9,1]]Job answered his friends and said:
[[Jb 9,2]]I know well that it is so; but how can a man be justified before God?
[[Jb 9,3]]Should one wish to contend with him, he could not answer him once in a thousand times.
[[Jb 9,4]]God is wise in heart and mighty in strength; who has withstood him and remained unscathed?
[[Jb 9,5]]He removes the mountains before they know it; he overturns them in his anger.
[[Jb 9,6]]He shakes the earth out of its place, and the pillars beneath it tremble.
[[Jb 9,7]]He commands the sun, and it rises not; he seals up the stars.
[[Jb 9,8]]He alone stretches out the heavens and treads upon the crests of the sea.
[[Jb 9,9]]He made the Bear and Orion, the Pleiades and the constellations of the south;
[[Jb 9,10]]He does great things past finding out, marvelous things beyond reckoning.
[[Jb 9,11]]Should he come near me, I see him not; should he pass by, I am not aware of him;
[[Jb 9,12]]Should he seize me forcibly, who can say him nay? Who can say to him, "What are you doing?"
[[Jb 9,14]]How much less shall I give him any answer, or choose out arguments against him!
[[Jb 9,15]]Even though I were right, I could not answer him, but should rather beg for what was due me.
[[Jb 9,16]]If I appealed to him and he answered my call, I could not believe that he would hearken to my words.
